isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200i/9400i/9900i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® before APRIL 2000

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® before APRIL 2000

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with Pro-Sleeper® before April 2000 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 14), two shock absorbers (Item 8), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 1). The air suspension assembly (Figure 114) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Items 21 and 23), elbow fittings (Item 25), air springs (bags) (Item 14), height control valve (Item 1), shock absorbers (Item 8) and lateral control arm (Item 26) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 1), air springs (bags) (Item 14) and shock absorbers (Item 8) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 114) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 1, Figure 114) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 115 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 3) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 7) is located on "SUPS" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 8), but not remove, and pull height control valve lever (Item 9) loose from drive bearing (Item 10) and rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 1) on cab mounting plate (Item 18).
Install two hex head bolts (Item 3) thru height control valve and cab mounting plate (Item 18) and install hex lock nuts (Item 4). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 115 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
Push "Y" push-in connector (Item 2) into "SUPS" port side of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push both air lines (to air springs) (Item 1) into "Y" push-in connector (Item 2) in "SUPS" port side of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 5) into "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (supply) (Item 4) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 5) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Install height control valve linkage (Item 6) onto threaded ball pivot of height control valve lever (Item 9) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate. Cab air suspension ride height is fixed and should be 6 1/2 inches (165.1 mm) (Figure 176) . Refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® BEFORE APRIL 2000
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position shock absorbers (Item 8) in place between cab mounting plate (Item 18) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 11).
Install hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 9 and 10) at the top and bottom of shock absorbers (Item 8). Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Place air springs (bags) (Item 14) in position between cab mounting plate (Item 18) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 11).
Thread each of the air springs (bags) (Item 14) on threaded studs (Item 27), screw each air spring (bag) down until bottom is tight against crossmember mounting plate (Item 11).

Release jack placed between frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) , lower cab, making sure top mounting studs of both air springs (bags) (Item 14) are positioned into mounting holes of cab mounting plate (Item 18).

Install retaining rings (Item 19) at the top of each of the air springs (bags) (Item 14) and securely press onto top stud of air springs (bags). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of retaining rings.

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) into top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 14). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 21) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) at the top of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 14). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) into top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 14). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 23) into push to connect elbow fitting (Item 25) at the top of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 14). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of cab mounting plate and top of crossmember mounting plate . Cab air suspension ride height is fixed and should be 6 1/2 inches (165.1 mm) (Figure 176) . Refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i MODELS WITH PRO-SLEEPER® BEFORE APRIL 2000
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 114 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 26) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 26) in mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 11) and install hex head bolt (Item 12) from the back thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate and lateral control rod (Item 3) and install hex lock nut (Item 13). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 26) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 18) and install hex head bolt (Item 12) from the back thru mounting bracket of cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 13). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
